revised_title: A Case of Polypus Resembling a Branch of the Pulmonary Vein Coughed Up by an Asthmatic Person
tldr: The author presents a case study of a patient with asthma who coughed up a polypus resembling a branch of the pulmonary vein. The polypus was fibrous, hollow, and resembled the structure of vessels in the lungs. The author suggests that this case may explain a similar case reported by Tulpius and provides insight into the nature of such polypi.
